channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: History of Tariffs
channel.desc: Professors Douglas Irwin (Dartmouth College), Sharon Ann Murphy (Providence College), and Eric Rauchway (University of California, Davis) discuss how the federal government historically has implemented tariffs and how they have impacted the economy.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Edward Dolnick, Dinosaurs at the Dinner Party
channel.desc: Author Edward Dolnick talks about the early 19th century paleontologists who discovered fossils, huge bones, and coined the term dinosaur.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Teaching African American History
channel.desc: Linda Salley, teacher and President and Executive Director of the African American Museum of Bucks County, Pennsylvania, discusses the importance of teaching African American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture Centennial
channel.desc: Simon & Schuster CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelly discuss how they are guiding their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1986 U.S. Patent and Trademark Office film, hosted by actor Ossie Davis, highlights the work of minority inventors and the patents they hold.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Martha Blanding & Tim O'Day, Groundbreaking Magic
channel.desc: Martha Blanding broke a color barrier at California's Disneyland, becoming the park's first Black official tour guide in 1971 - joining the highest ranks among Disney cast members as employees are known.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jos? Andr?s, Change the Recipe
channel.desc: Chef Jos Andrs talks about the life lessons he's learned through the work he does with the World Central Kitchen, an organization that feeds people in conflict and disaster zones around the world.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Daniel Samet, U.S. Defense Policy toward Israel
channel.desc: Ronald Reagan Institute fellow Daniel Samet discusses U.S. military policy toward Israel during the Cold War, which he says is dominated by U.S. strategic interests.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: In an interview with The Federalist's culture editor Emily Jahshinksy, Emory University professor Mark Bauerlein argues that the lack of general civics knowledge by millennials poses a threat to America's political and social institutions.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Gerald Horne, Armed Struggle?
channel.desc: Prof. Gerald Horne (Univ. of Houston) talks about the Black Liberation Movement in Southern California and its turn towards armed struggle during the 1960s and 1970s.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Judy Karofsky, DisElderly Conduct
channel.desc: Former Middleton, Wisconsin, mayor Judy Karofsky takes a critical look at the business of assisted living and hospice care in America.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Corinna Lain, Secrets of the Killing State
channel.desc: Corinna Lain (University of Richmond School of Law) takes a critical look at the use of lethal injection as a method of capital punishment. She argues that the reality of this form of execution is more brutal than is widely understood.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Vauhini Vara, Searches - Selfhood in the Digital Age
channel.desc: Journalist Vauhini Vara describes her experience with AI tools like ChatGPT, and the future of artificial intelligence. McNally Jackson Books in New York City hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Jason Riley, author of "The Affirmative Action Myth," argues that the racial preference policies of the 1960s and 1970s have had an overall negative impact on the success of Black Americans.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Long Island Histories
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 Gold Coast Book fair in Oyster Bay, New York.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Casey Burgat & Steve Israel, We Hold These Truths
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 Gold Coast Book fair in Oyster Bay, New York.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Russell Shorto, Taking Manhattan
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 Gaithersburg Book Festival in Maryland.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Thomas Maier, The Invisible Spy
channel.desc: Investigative reporter Thomas Maier profiles former NFL football player and World War II spy Ernest Cuneo, and his connection to British Prime Minister Winston Churchill's New York-based spy ring during the war.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Book Publishing CEO Roundtable
channel.desc: Simon & Schuster CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelly discuss how they are guiding their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.desc: Gavel-to-gavel and uninterrupted live coverage of the U.S. Senate from the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.
